data.text:
QUICK FACTS

Activities Composer , Music of the credits , Additional music (performers)

Nationality USA

Birth June 9, 1951 (Los Angeles, California – USA)

BIOGRAPHY

James Newton Howard is an American composer, with more than 100 films within his career. So far, James has several nominations throughout his career, at the Grammys, Emmys and the Academy Awards. Howard attended the Academy of Music of the West in Santa Barbara, California, and completed his formal education studying under the tutelage of arranger Marty Paich. Before collaborating for the seventh art, Howard had several successes as an arranger on albums by prominent musicians, including Elton John, for whom he worked as arranging Don’t Go Breaking My Heart and Sorry Seems to Be the Hardest. word, in addition to serving as keyboardist for several of the singer’s musical albums. On the other hand, James made an important name in the entertainment industry thanks to his work on the soundtracks of many important films of the 1990s and the beginning of the new millennium, including Pretty Woman (1990 ) . , Space Jam (1996), Batman, the Dark Knight (2008), among many others. Together with filmmaker Francis Lawrence he has built a great team, as he has composed the soundtrack for almost all of his films, including I Am Legend and the Hunger Games saga . In 2021, James Newton was nominated for a Golden Goble for his work on News of the World , starring Tom Hanks.
